==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{ja-kanjitab|か|ちょう|yomi=on}}
{{wikipedia|Householder}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=かちょう}} {{m|zh|家長}}.

===Pronunciation===
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/ka.t͡ɕo.o/|[kät͡ɕʲo̞ː]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かちょう}}

# the [[head]] of a [[household]], a [[householder]]
# a [[patriarch]]
# a [[matriarch]]

====Usage notes====
Historically, this role has more commonly been filled by a man. However, this word alone is generally not [[gender]]-[[specific]], and can refer to either a male or female head of household. To specify a particular gender, this word may be prefixed with either {{m|ja|女|tr=onna||woman}} or {{m|ja|男|tr=otoko||man}}.

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|族長|ぞくちょう}}: the head of a [[family]] or [[clan]]

====See also====
* {{ja-r|女家長|おんな かちょう}}: a [[matriarch]], the [[female]] head of a household
* {{ja-r|男家長|おとこ かちょう}}: a [[patriarch]], the [[male]] head of a household
* {{ja-r|女族長|おんな ぞくちょう}}: a [[matriarch]], the [[female]] head of a family or clan
* {{ja-r|男族長|おとこ ぞくちょう}}: a [[patriarch]], the [[male]] head of a family or clan
